data.name: Decimal Period in Prime Reciprocals
data.description:
# Decimal Period in Prime Reciprocals #

A reciprocal (or inverse) of a number is 1 divided by the number. For example:

* Reciprocal of 23 = 1/23 = 0.0434782608695652...

The [decimal period](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclic_number#Relation_to_repeating_decimals) is the repeating part of the decimals of a cyclic number (a number with an infinite number of decimals that have a repeating pattern). Better understood with an example:

* 1/13 = 0.076923076923076923076923076923076923...  = 0.076923 076923 076923 076923 076923 076923 ... 

* The decimal period is "076923". Its number of digits is 6.



**Your task is to compute the number of digits in the decimal period of the reciprocal of a given prime (5 < n < 20000).**

Note: you don't need to check if the given number is prime, no tests include non-prime numbers.

Watch this [Numberphile Channel video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DmfxIhmGPP4&t=685s) if interested. Your code will be able to accomplish in minutes what an 19th century mathematician took decades to do!
